page.title: 15Clubs in Saxilby Area
page.content: Saxilby has a great variety of clubs catering for all age groups. They meet in the Village Hall, Church or Chapel Halls and clubrooms on the recreation field. The Scout Movement has its own HQ. The Youth Club meets in the former St. Andrews Church. There are 2 pre-school playgroups and a thriving School Association. An occupational therapist attends the weekly meeting of physically handicapped adults. The Drama Circle produced Trial and Error in May 1985 and their Old Tyme Music Hall is very popular. Foss Folk Ladies Choir give concerts. Saxilby Young People are producing a song and dance extravaganza. The church organises a childrens' holiday club for 3 days in August. The Gardeners Association held their Annual Show in September with a high standard of entries. Fund raising is an activity of most clubs.
